snippet: The legislation approved by the Banking Committee is aimed at forcing the expulsion of Iran’s banks from the global telecommunications network that nearly all banks rely on.
abstract: Senate Banking Committee unanimously approves legislation aimed at forcing Swift, the Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication, to expel Iranian banks that have already been blacklisted from its network; measure, which would be financially catastrophic for Iran if carried out fully, is strong message to the global financial telecommunications network to end its business in Iran.
lead_paragraph: The legislation approved by the Banking Committee is aimed at forcing the expulsion of Iran’s banks from the global telecommunications network that nearly all banks rely on.

headline.seo: Tough Iran Penalty Clears Senate Banking Panel
headline.main: Senate Panel Approves Potentially Toughest Penalty Yet Against Iran’s Wallet
headline.print_headline: Senate Panel Approves Potentially Toughest Penalty Yet Against Iran’s Wallet
